headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Nvidia Goes Big on Intel
summary: What Happened in Markets Today Nvidia bets $5 billion on Intel. Intel's shares jumped 23% by the closing bell, even after both companies made clear that the deal doesn't involve volume commitments for Intel's unprofitable chip-manufacturing business.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Nvidia Goes Big on Intel
raw.summary: What Happened in Markets Today Nvidia bets $5 billion on Intel. Intel's shares jumped 23% by the closing bell, even after both companies made clear that the deal doesn't involve volume commitments for Intel's unprofitable chip-manufacturing business.

headline: Why Are Analysts Downgrading Applied Materials, Inc. (AMAT)?
summary: Applied Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMAT) is among the 15 Stocks ChatGPT Predicts Could Make You Wealthy in 5 Years. headline: AMAT's Advanced DRAM Gains Traction: Will it Sustain its Momentum?
summary: Applied Materials sees DRAM-driven momentum with record etch revenues, AI-fueled demand, and growth opportunities in advanced memory.

headline: TSMC, Arm, AMD: Winners and Losers After Nvidia's Intel Investment
summary: Nvidia’s $5 billion investment in Intel is punishing competitors like AMD and circuit-design firm Arm, each of which fell more than 4.5% Thursday morning.  Nvidia and Intel haven't said how many chips they will develop together or when they are expected to be produced.  It is unknown to what extent the investment will bolster Intel’s bid to become a big contract chip-maker and challenge the world-leading TSMC.

headline: This Week In Energy Transition - Elcogen's New Factory Powers Europe's Clean Energy Future
summary: Elcogen has inaugurated a new high-volume solid oxide fuel cell factory in Tallinn, Estonia, marking a significant expansion in clean technology production to meet global demand for efficient and sustainable energy solutions. The facility, spanning 14,000 m², dramatically boosts Elcogen's production capacity from 10 MW to 360 MW, positioning the company as a major player in Europe's clean energy transition. This development supports the drive to reduce industrial emissions and enhance energy...

headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq futures hit record highs after Fed cuts rates; Intel soars
summary: U.S. stock index futures gained on Thursday, with those tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq at record highs a day after the U.S. central bank delivered a quarter-point interest rate cut, while Intel climbed after Nvidia decided to build a stake in the company.  Intel jumped 31% in premarket trading after Nvidia said on Thursday that it will invest $5 billion, throwing its heft behind the struggling U.S. chip foundry, but stopped short of giving Intel a crucial manufacturing deal.
